div1.p: John Kasson was born in Charlotte, Vermont in 1822 and died in Washington, D.C. in 1910. A lawyer and long-time resident of Des Moines, Iowa, Kasson entered national public service in 1863, when he served as a member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Iowa's 5th congressional district. He served until 1867. He also represented Iowa's 7th congressional district during the 1873–1877 and 1881–1884. He held diplomatic posts as U.S. Ambassador to Austria-Hungary (1877-1881) and to the German Empire (1884–1885).
